content:
In an Excel sheet, I have a list of motivational quotes for different situations. I want to generate an encouragement statement for a colleague who is feeling overwhelmed.
Here's a snapshot of the sheet:
| Situation               | Quote                                          |
|-------------------------|------------------------------------------------|
| Overwhelmed          | "Believe in yourself and all that you are."   |
| Lost                      | "Don't wait for opportunities, create them."|
| Stressed               | "One small positive thought can change your whole day."|
| Discouraged       | "If you're feeling low, don't despair. The sun has a sinking spell every night, but it comes back up every morning."|
| Burned out          | "Rest when you're weary. Refresh and renew yourself, your body, your mind, your spirit. Then get back to work."|
What is the encouragement statement I can generate for my colleague who is feeling overwhelmed?

Based on the motivational quote for the "Overwhelmed" situation in your Excel sheet, you can craft the following encouragement statement for your colleague:

"Hey [Colleague's Name], I know things might feel overwhelming right now, but remember to believe in yourself and all that you are. You have the strength and capability to handle this, and I am here to support you every step of the way."
